angry.description: Released in 1963, 'Mingus Ah Um' by Charles Mingus is a powerful and intense jazz album. Known for its innovative compositions and emotional depth, tracks like 'Fables of Faubus' express a strong sense of anger and social commentary.
angry.name: Mingus Ah Um

chill.description: Released in 1959, 'Kind of Blue' by Miles Davis is a quintessential jazz album known for its cool, laid-back atmosphere. Featuring tracks like 'So What' and 'Freddie Freeloader,' the album is perfect for relaxation and chill vibes.
chill.name: Kind of Blue

happy.description: Released in 1956, 'Ella and Louis' is a delightful collaboration between Ella Fitzgerald and Louis Armstrong. The album features joyful and uplifting performances of jazz standards like 'Cheek to Cheek' and 'They Can't Take That Away from Me.'
happy.name: Ella and Louis

love.description: Released in 1957, 'Ballads' by John Coltrane is a deeply romantic and introspective album. Featuring tender renditions of standards like 'My One and Only Love' and 'I Wish I Knew,' the album is perfect for a mood of love and intimacy.
love.name: Ballads

sad.description: Released in 1956, 'Lady in Satin' by Billie Holiday is a poignant and emotional album that captures the depth of Holiday's feelings. Tracks like 'I'm a Fool to Want You' and 'You've Changed' reflect themes of sadness and vulnerability.
sad.name: Lady in Satin
